attributes.action: Demand an apology for the behaviour of MP's following the vote on bombing Syria
attributes.additional_details:
House of Commons debate on air strikes in Syria against ISIS, 2nd December 2015

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/syria-air-strikes-mhairi-black-vows-never-to-forget-the-noise-of-mps-cheering-bombs-a6758231.html
attributes.background: Following the Commons debate on air strikes in Syria, a number of MP's supporting the Government were seen laughing and cheering, which as a wholly inappropriate behaviour for such a serious decision, which will no doubt involve the deaths of innocent civilians and endanger military personnel.

rejection.details: The behaviour of individual MPs, and a decision about whether to apologise for their actions, is the responsibility of the individuals concerned, not the UK Government or the House of Commons as a whole.
